newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco's Eqdom Credit profit down in 96.
newsitem.headline: Morocco's Eqdom Credit profit down in 96.

text.p: Moroccan credit firm Eqdom Credit on Thursday reported lower provisional net profit in 1996 of 96 million dirhams ($10.32 million) from 114.4 million the year before.
The results in the weekly economic newspaper L'Economiste showed a turnover of 279 million dirhams in 1996 but gave no comparative figure for the previous year.
Eqdom was set up in 1974 by holding Societe Nationale d'Investissement and major insurance companies.
Listed on the Casablanca stock exchange, it was traded on March 27 at 1015 dirhams. ($1=9.3 dirhams)
